net.minecraft.block

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minecraftforge.registries.ForgeRegistryEntry<Block>
      • net.minecraft.block.Block
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IItemProvider, IForgeBlock, IForgeRegistryEntry<Block>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockAir, BlockBarrier, BlockBasePressurePlate, BlockBookshelf, BlockBreakable, BlockBubbleColumn, BlockBush, BlockCactus, BlockCake, BlockCarpet, BlockCauldron, BlockChorusFlower, BlockClay, BlockContainer, BlockCoral, BlockCoralPlantBase, BlockDirectional, BlockDirtSnowy, BlockDoor, BlockEmptyDrops, BlockEndPortalFrame, BlockFalling, BlockFarmland, BlockFire, BlockFlowerPot, BlockFlowingFluid, BlockFourWay, BlockGlowstone, BlockGrassPath, BlockHorizontal, BlockHugeMushroom, BlockKelp, BlockKelpTop, BlockLadder, BlockLeaves, BlockMagma, BlockNote, BlockOre, BlockPackedIce, BlockPortal, BlockRailBase, BlockRedstone, BlockRedstoneLamp, BlockRedstoneOre, BlockRedstoneWire, BlockReed, BlockRotatedPillar, BlockSeaLantern, BlockSilverfish, BlockSixWay, BlockSlab, BlockSnow, BlockSnowLayer, BlockSoulSand, BlockSponge, BlockStairs, BlockStemGrown, BlockStone, BlockStructureVoid, BlockTNT, BlockTorch, BlockTripWire, BlockTripWireHook, BlockTurtleEgg, BlockVine, BlockWeb, BlockWetSponge, BlockWorkbench

extends ForgeRegistryEntry<Block>
implements IItemProvider, IForgeBlock

      • getSlipperiness

        public float getSlipperiness(IBlockState state,
                             IWorldReader world,
                             BlockPos pos,
                             @Nullable
                             Entity entity)
        Description copied from interface: IForgeBlock
        Gets the slipperiness at the given location at the given state. Normally between 0 and 1.

        Note that entities may reduce slipperiness by a certain factor of their own; for EntityLivingBase, this is .91. EntityItem uses .98, and EntityFishHook uses .92.

        Specified by:
        getSlipperiness in interface IForgeBlock
        Parameters:
        state - state of the block
        world - the world
        pos - the position in the world
        entity - the entity in question
        Returns:
        the factor by which the entity's motion should be multiplied

      • canSilkHarvest

        public boolean canSilkHarvest(IBlockState state,
                              IWorldReader world,
                              BlockPos pos,
                              EntityPlayer player)
        Description copied from interface: IForgeBlock
        Return true from this function if the player with silk touch can harvest this block directly, and not it's normal drops.
        Specified by:
        canSilkHarvest in interface IForgeBlock
        Parameters:
        state - current block state
        world - The world
        pos - Block position in world
        player - The player doing the harvesting
        Returns:
        True if the block can be directly harvested using silk touch

      • getHarvestTool

        @Nullable
public ToolType getHarvestTool(IBlockState state)
        Description copied from interface: IForgeBlock
        Queries the class of tool required to harvest this block, if null is returned we assume that anything can harvest this block.

      • getHarvestLevel

        public int getHarvestLevel(IBlockState state)
        Description copied from interface: IForgeBlock
        Queries the harvest level of this item stack for the specified tool class, Returns -1 if this tool is not of the specified type
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • canSustainPlant

        public boolean canSustainPlant(IBlockState state,
                               IBlockReader world,
                               BlockPos pos,
                               EnumFacing facing,
                               IPlantable plantable)
        Description copied from interface: IForgeBlock
        Determines if this block can support the passed in plant, allowing it to be planted and grow. Some examples: Reeds check if its a reed, or if its sand/dirt/grass and adjacent to water Cacti checks if its a cacti, or if its sand Nether types check for soul sand Crops check for tilled soil Caves check if it's a solid surface Plains check if its grass or dirt Water check if its still water
        Specified by:
        canSustainPlant in interface IForgeBlock
        Parameters:
        state - The Current state
        world - The current world
        facing - The direction relative to the given position the plant wants to be, typically its UP
        plantable - The plant that wants to check
        Returns:
        True to allow the plant to be planted/stay.
